acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement AES-256-GCM Encryption Helpers for Sensitive Patient Fields is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (4.3 Data Security; 9 lib/encryption.ts) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/encryption.test.ts
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented versioned AES-256-GCM encryption/decryption helpers with AAD support plus patient-field encryption wrappers. Node test coverage verifies round-trip encryption, non-deterministic IV behavior, tamper rejection, JSON payload encryption, and wrong-tenant AAD rejection.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Negative crypto artifact: tests cover tampered ciphertext rejection and wrong-tenant AAD rejection (`clinic-b` decrypt on `clinic-a` payload).
Design note: `lib/encryption.ts` lazy-loads env access so tests can inject a test key without loading server-only env modules.
Implementation commit: 2dc52bf (feat(healio-security): add patient data encryption helpers).
